title: Müller House
text:
The Müller House is a historic house located at 500 North Vail Avenue in <a href="Arlington%20Heights%2C%20Illinois">Arlington Heights</a>, <a href="Illinois">Illinois</a>. F.W. Müller built the house for his family and their <a href="soda%20water">soda water</a> business in 1882. The Müller business was one of the first commercial establishments in Arlington Heights and was part of the city's early transition from a rural settlement to a large suburb of <a href="Chicago">Chicago</a>. The house is also an uncommon blend of architectural styles; while it features a <a href="Greek%20Revival%20architecture">Greek Revival</a> <a href="cornice">cornice</a> with scrolled <a href="bracket%20%28architecture%29">bracket</a>s and a symmetrical front facade, the style is not seen elsewhere in the house, which otherwise has a <a href="Victorian%20architecture">Victorian</a> design. The design also combines the functional necessities of the factory with the decorative features of a middle-class home; prominent among the latter is the house's woodwork, which includes a carved <a href="oak">oak</a> staircase.
The house was added to the <a href="National%20Register%20of%20Historic%20Places">National Register of Historic Places</a> on March 26, 1979. It is now part of the Arlington Heights Historical Museum.
